file_content.text: The Rakata imprisoned the Esh-kha in maximum security, guarded by their strongest defenses.
The deepest cells were saved for the Esh-kha leaders, including one named "Hallow Voice."
Unlike the other Esh-kha, Hallow Voice and his followers tried to work with other species. He may be interested in becoming your ally.
Hopefully Hallow Voice and I can come to an accord.
I'll make my case to him.
"Deepest cells and strongest defenses" sounds problematic.
How can I reach Hallow Voice?
There is more.
If Hallow Voice won't battle the Empire, he's no use to me.
As long as he will fight.
That's a decision for Hallow Voice. Not you or I.
Unfortunately your enemy, the Empire, has released many hostile Esh-kha during the riots.
Is Scorekeeper's blessing. They will have chance to recover points.
Now safety protocols have locked down the stasis chambers, including that of Hallow Voice. They cannot be opened.
Then disengaging those protocols should be my first priority.
I'll need to cut the safeties.
Will those safety protocols endanger Hallow Voice or his people?
Is Hallow Voice alright?
They are safe for now. Their violent cousins are a greater threat.
My lightsaber can open them.
No! Breaking the chambers will kill anything inside!
The chambers will be unlocked if the prison receives an "all clear" signal. Much like... this one.
Go to high security and enter this signal at two control stations. Then, you may free Hallow Voice's followers from maximum security.
What will you be doing in the meantime?
And where will you be?
I have... other business.
I appreciate this.
Hold your thanks. You've not yet seen the way ahead.
You'd better hope it works.
If you fail, I am better dead anyway.
Walk softly, Jedi. Your Republic kept their very worst in high security, and the walls are crumbling.
The category ten tag is removed, and the other is locked out of the system. For now.
We can speak. You're hunting for the Esh-kha. You are on the right path, but you will need my help from here.
What do you know of the Esh-kha?
Tell me what you can.
Once I know your name.
I can share my knowledge but not my name.
Forgive me if I don't find that comforting.
Right, because nothing inspires trust like hiding your identity.
I have no interest in being your pawn.
Don't try manipulating me!
Listen first, then judge.
Sorry, Jedi. That terminal's already been neutralized.
Welcome to Belsavis. I'm Commander Geland. And you've just wandered into my territory.
I know what you are. I've encountered your "siblings" already.
You're a Child of the Emperor.
Yes, Blaesus always had a theatrical streak. But now you're here.
I have little patience for a murderer's ranting.
I've no time for this.
But you'll make time for a species who committed galactic genocide.
"Your territory"? Please.
I know you came for the Esh-kha. But they won't be following you anywhere.
This prison, and everything in it, is mine. Every droid, turret and camera. You're a rat in a very big cage, and you'll die like one.
You can destroy my body, but I will always be part of the Force.
Death does not scare me.
As you like.
Big talk for a prison guard.
Thank you. But I'm not finished.
That's disappointing. I was hoping for an honorable opponent who would meet me face-to-face.
Afraid to challenge me?
Let's see if you can run the gauntlet first.
You're now a category ten escapee. The prison's systems are authorized to kill you on sight.
Better death than capture, dark thing!
You won't survive the onslaught for very long.
Jedi, can you hear me?
Yes. What's your name?
Who are you?
I'm listening....
I am a friend.
Let me guess, another of Commander Geland's games.
This is a trick.
No. Unlike the other, I am a friend.
Friends don't hide.
There's little time. The other has put a category ten tag on you. You must remove the tag, or you'll never survive Belsavis.
The terminal here will remove the tag, but first it must be repaired.
You appear well-acquainted with Belsavis.
How do you know this?
Focus, Jedi! If you die here, who will the Esh-kha follow?
I need more details.
How do I know you're not setting a trap?
I don't trust you.
I can't prove my intentions, but if you extend a hand, I can guide you to the Esh-kha.
This terminal's self-repair module has been removed. A new module from another Rakata terminal, with some Republic parts as raw materials, should fix it.
Take this data, to guide you. Disassemble these terminals to find what you need.
Be cautious. The terminals lie in dangerous--
Reconnecting to network. Caution: category ten prisoner detected using terminal. Lethal force is authorized.
Terminal has reconnected to network. Touch any key to reinitialize.
